articles.title: The best rice cooker for 2025

articles.summary: Media Matters for America has sued the US Federal Trade Commission, claiming that the agency is unfairly targeting it in retaliation for past criticisms of the social media platform X in violation of the organization's First Amendment rights. articles.title: The Vera C. Rubin Observatory shares first images from planned decade-long survey of the sky

Rubin Observatory, a sample of the footage it'll capture as part of a planned decade-long survey that's starting later in 2025. The project, dubbed the "Legacy Survey of Time and Space" is predicted to lead to the discovery of "millions of new asteroids within the first two years" the survey is running. articles.title: The Xbox PC app will soon integrate your various game libraries into one place

articles.title: US House reportedly bans WhatsApp on government devices
articles.summary: US congressional staffers have reportedly been told that they're no longer allowed to use WhatsApp on government devices. The House of Representatives' chief administrative officer (CAO) is said to have informed workers on Monday that the app — including the mobile, desktop and web-based versions — is not permitted on House-managed devices. articles.title: Dell 16 Plus 2-in-1 review: Technically proficient but lacking soul

However, after the company revamped its naming scheme earlier this year, all of its consumer PCs now share its name, with a few extra identifiers that call out size, design and status (aka how fancy it is). articles.title: F1 the Movie review: A shameless Apple ad that will blow your socks off
articles.summary: The first thing in F1 the Movie, before a single word of dialog is uttered, is a pair of AirPods Max. They're so comfortable, Brad Pitt's lovable loser protagonist Sonny Hayes is able to sleep with them all night, then hop up and begin his day of driving fancy race cars. articles.title: Lenovo promises 17 hours of battery life on its new Chromebook Plus 14

articles.summary: Noise-cancelling headphones are a must-have for anyone who travels often and wants to drown out airplane noise, commuters who want some peace and quiet amongst the crowds and anyone else looking to dull the daily chaos of life. articles.summary: A Swedish startup is taking defence tech back to basics — by building the country’s first TNT factory since the Cold War. Located in Nora, a town about three hours from the capital, the factory is expected to produce more than 4,000 tonnes of TNT a year.
